content: sharks if you see steep flaky cliffs around the cleveland area you re probably looking at the cleveland shale repeat row 1 6 once more k one more row plain removing markers as you come to them bobble loosely on next ws row finishing weave in the ends and soak block aggressively following the natural curve of the lace to smooth the fabric and open up the eyelets that s it you re done enjoy your kickass new shawl questions comments just want to say hi email me at christineparkerco@gmail com ©2021 christine parker for personal non-commercial use only not for resale or distribution without permission 4 about the designer christine parker is a romance-book-editor-turned-knitting-designer from cleveland ohio who specializes in uncomplicated engaging patterns for distractible knitters find her on instagram at @christineparkerco where she recommends books shares pictures of her bulldogs and swears a lot her website is christineparkerco com about the pattern what happens when you take one of the oldest and most easily recognized shetland lace stitches in history blow it up to three times its normal size and knit it in an eye-searing neon yarn you get the cleveland shale shawl a newfangled take on a traditional favorite the cleveland shale shawl reinvents the classic old shale stitch for modern knitters this easy rectangular shawl pattern uses basic increases and decreases and works up quickly on us 9 / 5 5 mm needles using dk weight yarn it s simple enough for beginner lace knitters and sufficiently varied to hold even the most seasoned knitter s interest for best results choose a semi-solid or subtly variegated yarn the lace details and undulating texture may get lost in high contrast colorways ©2021 christine parker for personal non-commercial use only not for resale or distribution without permission
